snippet: The Taliban claimed responsibility for an attack in which a suicide bomber cleared a path for two gunmen, who ran in and fired on diners.
abstract: Taliban strikes a restaurant popular with Westerners in downtown Kabul, Afghanistan, in what appears to be a well-coordinated assault, with a suicide bomber clearing a path for two gunmen; at least 16 people are killed, most of them foreigners.

byline.contributor: Jawad Sukhanyar, Habib Zahori and Haris Kakar contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The Taliban claimed responsibility for an attack in which a suicide bomber cleared a path for two gunmen, who ran in and fired on diners.

headline.main: Taliban Attack Kills 16 at Restaurant Favored by Westerners
headline.print_headline: Taliban Attack Restaurant Favored by Westerners
